issue.title: [SYSE-15]: Change smoke tests back to split approach
issue.body:
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description

The template changes in https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/pull/5681 caused changes in the updated smoke test workflow by unifying the split running of `ci/tests/` and `smoke-tests`.
This PR reverts it.

comment.body:
## PR Analysis

- 🎯 **Main theme:** Reverting the unified running of ci/tests and smoke-tests to a split approach.
- 📝 **PR summary:** This PR reverts the changes made in a previous PR that unified the running of ci/tests and smoke-tests. The changes are made in the release.yml file where separate jobs are now defined for running ci/tests and smoke-tests.
- 📌 **Type of PR:** Bug fix
- 🧪 **Relevant tests added:** No
- ⏱️ **Estimated effort to review [1-5]:** 2, because the PR is straightforward and only involves changes in the CI/CD pipeline configuration.
- 🔒 **Security concerns:** No security concerns found
## PR Feedback

- 💡 **General suggestions:** The PR is well-structured and the changes are clear. However, it would be beneficial to include a brief explanation of why the split approach is preferred over the unified one.


- **<details><summary> 🤖 Code feedback:**</summary>


  - **relevant file:** ``.github/workflows/release.yml``
   **suggestion:** Consider adding error handling or a fallback mechanism in case the tests in the directories 'ci/tests' or 'smoke-tests' fail to run. This will ensure that the pipeline does not break unexpectedly. [important]
   **relevant line:** [- name: Run ci/tests](https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/pull/5693/files#diff-87db21a973eed4fef5f32b267aa60fcee5cbdf03c67fafdc2a9b553bb0b15f34R411)

</details>


### How to use
> To invoke the PR-Agent, add a comment using one of the following commands:
> **/review [-i]**: Request a review of your Pull Request. For an incremental review, which only considers changes since the last review, include the '-i' option.
> **/describe**: Modify the PR title and description based on the contents of the PR.
> **/improve [--extended]**: Suggest improvements to the code in the PR. Extended mode employs several calls, and provides a more thorough feedback. 
> **/ask \<QUESTION\>**: Pose a question about the PR.
> **/update_changelog**: Update the changelog based on the PR's contents.

>To edit any configuration parameter from **configuration.toml**, add --config_path=new_value
>For example: /review --pr_reviewer.extra_instructions="focus on the file: ..." 
>To list the possible configuration parameters, use the **/config** command.

issue.title: TT-10344 Fix rpc ClientIsConnected
issue.body:
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
Reverting changes introduced in `func (r rpcOpts) ClientIsConnected() bool`  on https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/pull/5643.

`clientIsConnected` fn is called on `FuncClientSingleton` https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/blob/master/rpc/rpc_client.go#L469 and if it fails while trying to `GroupLogin`,  the function `recoverOps` will not ever be able to recover https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/blob/master/rpc/rpc_client.go#L444 and exit emergency mode.




## Related Issue

<!-- This project only accepts pull requests related to open issues. -->
<!-- If suggesting a new feature or change, please discuss it in an issue first. -->
<!-- If fixing a bug, there should be an issue describing it with steps to reproduce. -->
<!-- OSS: Please link to the issue here. Tyk: please create/link the JIRA ticket. -->

## Motivation and Context

<!-- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->

## How This Has Been Tested

<!-- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes -->
<!-- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests -->
<!-- you ran to see how your change affects other areas of the code, etc. -->
<!-- This information is helpful for reviewers and QA. -->

## Screenshots (if appropriate)

## Types of changes

<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
- [ ] Refactoring or add test (improvements in base code or adds test coverage to functionality)

## Checklist

<!-- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply -->
<!-- If there are no documentation updates required, mark the item as checked. -->
<!-- Raise up any additional concerns not covered by the checklist. -->

- [ ] I ensured that the documentation is up to date
- [ ] I explained why this PR updates go.mod in detail with reasoning why it's required
- [ ] I would like a code coverage CI quality gate exception and have explained why

comment.body:
**API tests result: success** :white_check_mark: 
Branch used: refs/pull/5692/merge
Commit:  
Triggered by: pull_request (@tbuchaillot)
[Execution page](https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/actions/runs/6666339728)

issue.title: TT-10344 Fix rpc ClientIsConnected
issue.body:
<!-- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
Reverting changes introduced in `func (r rpcOpts) ClientIsConnected() bool`  on https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/pull/5643.

`clientIsConnected` fn is called on `FuncClientSingleton` https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/blob/master/rpc/rpc_client.go#L469 and if it fails while trying to `GroupLogin`,  the function `recoverOps` will not ever be able to recover https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/blob/master/rpc/rpc_client.go#L444 and exit emergency mode.




## Related Issue

<!-- This project only accepts pull requests related to open issues. -->
<!-- If suggesting a new feature or change, please discuss it in an issue first. -->
<!-- If fixing a bug, there should be an issue describing it with steps to reproduce. -->
<!-- OSS: Please link to the issue here. Tyk: please create/link the JIRA ticket. -->

<!-- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->

## How This Has Been Tested

<!-- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes -->
<!-- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests -->
<!-- you ran to see how your change affects other areas of the code, etc. -->
<!-- This information is helpful for reviewers and QA. -->

## Screenshots (if appropriate)

<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

- [ ] I explained why this PR updates go.mod in detail with reasoning why it's required
- [ ] I would like a code coverage CI quality gate exception and have explained why

comment.body:
## PR Analysis

- 🎯 **Main theme:** Reverting changes in rpc ClientIsConnected function
- 📝 **PR summary:** This PR reverts changes made to the `ClientIsConnected` function in the `rpcOpts` struct. The changes were originally introduced in a previous PR, but they caused issues with the `recoverOps` function not being able to recover if `GroupLogin` fails. The PR also updates the corresponding tests.
- 📌 **Type of PR:** Bug fix
- 🧪 **Relevant tests added:** Yes
- ⏱️ **Estimated effort to review [1-5]:** 2, because the PR is quite straightforward, it only reverts a change and updates the corresponding tests.
- 🔒 **Security concerns:** No security concerns found
## PR Feedback

- 💡 **General suggestions:** The PR seems to be well-structured and the changes are clear. It's good to see that the corresponding tests have been updated to reflect the changes. However, it would be beneficial to add more context or reasoning in the PR description about why the previous changes were problematic and why this revert is necessary.


- **<details><summary> 🤖 Code feedback:**</summary>


  - **relevant file:** ``rpc/rpc_client.go``
   **suggestion:** Consider adding a comment above the `ClientIsConnected` function to explain why it doesn't check for `emergencyMode` anymore. This could prevent future misunderstandings or reintroduction of the same issue. [medium]
   **relevant line:** [return v.(bool)](https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/pull/5692/files#diff-3b88914c99bb9418e44e6389ce73579843562e8900730b380d7fff2e95c51033R75)


  - **relevant file:** ``rpc/rpc_client_test.go``
   **suggestion:** It would be beneficial to add more test cases to cover different scenarios and edge cases. This could help prevent potential issues in the future. [medium]
   **relevant line:** [name:      "When client is disconnected and not in emergency mode",](https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/pull/5692/files#diff-c691cf371db8b315d34af0189990bcf51ae4e5284d12a1492623efc9d01d16f4R57)

</details>


### How to use
> To invoke the PR-Agent, add a comment using one of the following commands:
> **/review [-i]**: Request a review of your Pull Request. For an incremental review, which only considers changes since the last review, include the '-i' option.
> **/describe**: Modify the PR title and description based on the contents of the PR.
> **/improve [--extended]**: Suggest improvements to the code in the PR. Extended mode employs several calls, and provides a more thorough feedback. 
> **/ask \<QUESTION\>**: Pose a question about the PR.
> **/update_changelog**: Update the changelog based on the PR's contents.

>To edit any configuration parameter from **configuration.toml**, add --config_path=new_value
>For example: /review --pr_reviewer.extra_instructions="focus on the file: ..." 
>To list the possible configuration parameters, use the **/config** command.

issue.title: [TT-10370] Alias imports
issue.body:
This PR aliases imports within gateway packages, so the aliases are non-conflicting inside individual package scopes.

To verify, run the following:

```
go install github.com/TykTechnologies/exp/cmd/go-fsck@978afcf81429325b9dcf51ec2afcc77a3d83e338
```

```
go-fsck lint ; echo $?
```

The command should exit with status 0 printed in the last line; The command prints a few warnings around ignored files due to build tags. This is expected and can be ignored.

https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-10370

comment.body:
**API tests result: success** :white_check_mark: 
Branch used: refs/pull/5691/merge
Commit: 815c55acd6a3a9bba29033c0962f3f2c23573f73 
Triggered by: pull_request (@titpetric)
[Execution page](https://github.com/TykTechnologies/tyk/actions/runs/6665870460)

issue.title: [TT-10370] Alias imports
issue.body:
This PR aliases imports within gateway packages, so the aliases are non-conflicting inside individual package scopes.

To verify, run the following:

```
go install github.com/TykTechnologies/exp/cmd/go-fsck@978afcf81429325b9dcf51ec2afcc77a3d83e338
```

```
go-fsck lint ; echo $?
```

The command should exit with status 0 printed in the last line; The command prints a few warnings around ignored files due to build tags. This is expected and can be ignored.

comment.body:
## PR Analysis

- 🎯 **Main theme:** Alias imports
- 📝 **PR summary:** This PR focuses on aliasing imports within gateway packages to avoid conflicts inside individual package scopes. It includes changes in multiple files, primarily in Go language, where imports have been aliased to provide clarity and avoid conflicts.
- 📌 **Type of PR:** Refactoring
- 🧪 **Relevant tests added:** No

### How to use
> To invoke the PR-Agent, add a comment using one of the following commands:
> **/review [-i]**: Request a review of your Pull Request. For an incremental review, which only considers changes since the last review, include the '-i' option.
> **/describe**: Modify the PR title and description based on the contents of the PR.
> **/improve [--extended]**: Suggest improvements to the code in the PR. Extended mode employs several calls, and provides a more thorough feedback. 
> **/ask \<QUESTION\>**: Pose a question about the PR.
> **/update_changelog**: Update the changelog based on the PR's contents.

>To edit any configuration parameter from **configuration.toml**, add --config_path=new_value
>For example: /review --pr_reviewer.extra_instructions="focus on the file: ..." 
>To list the possible configuration parameters, use the **/config** command.

issue.title: [TT-10370] Alias imports
issue.body:
This PR aliases imports within gateway packages, so the aliases are non-conflicting inside individual package scopes.

To verify, run the following:

```
go install github.com/TykTechnologies/exp/cmd/go-fsck@978afcf81429325b9dcf51ec2afcc77a3d83e338
```

```
go-fsck lint ; echo $?
```

The command should exit with status 0 printed in the last line; The command prints a few warnings around ignored files due to build tags. This is expected and can be ignored.

https://tyktech.atlassian.net/browse/TT-10370

comment.body:
API Changes
```diff
--- prev.txt	2023-10-27 10:15:16.052659064 +0000
+++ current.txt	2023-10-27 10:15:10.880630011 +0000
@@ -6581,7 +6581,7 @@
 func (a APIDefinitionLoader) ParseOAS(r io.Reader) (oas oas.OAS)
 
 type APIError struct {
-	Message template.HTML
+	Message htmlTemplate.HTML
 }
     APIError is generic error object returned if there is something wrong with
     the request
@@ -9200,7 +9200,7 @@
 
 type TransformSpec struct {
 	apidef.TemplateMeta
-	Template *template.Template
+	Template *textTemplate.Template
 }
 
 type TykGoPluginResponseHandler interface {
@@ -10674,7 +10674,7 @@
 func IsEnabled() bool
     IsEnabled returns true if the global trace manager is enabled.
 
-func Log(ctx context.Context, fields ...log.Field)
+func Log(ctx context.Context, fields ...opentracingLog.Field)
     Log tries to check if there is a span in ctx and adds logs fields on the
     span.
 
@@ -10827,7 +10827,7 @@
 
 func (s Span) LogEventWithPayload(event string, payload interface{})
 
-func (s Span) LogFields(fields ...log.Field)
+func (s Span) LogFields(fields ...opentracingLog.Field)
 
 func (s Span) LogKV(alternatingKeyValues ...interface{})
 
```

## Apply [Sweep Rules](https://docs.sweep.dev/usage/config#rules) to your PR?

- [ ] **Apply:**  All new business logic should have corresponding unit tests in the tests/ directory.

commits.message:
[TT-6157] Add test for multiple server tags (#5490)

Improve tests

Co-authored-by: Tit Petric <tit@tyk.io>
Alias math/rand and crypto/rand, use internal/crypto over crypto
Fix html/template and text/template in tests
Add aliases to internal crypto and httputil
Fix aliases to regexp, some import reorders
